title: Cramer warns investors that Powell won't go easy on stocks: 'The Fed is not your friend'
description: "While [Powell's] not explicitly trying to send stocks lower, he's certainly not going to shed any tears over it," Cramer said.

title: East Coast ports including New York are winning a domestic trade war at the expense of California
description: Port of New York and New Jersey says it will top California for the fourth consecutive month in cargo volume, and it has no plans to ever give back the gains.

title: Google vs. ChatGPT: Here's what happened when I swapped services for a day
description: OpenAI's ChatGPT chatbot has been getting a lot of attention for its ability to provide answers to complicated queries. Could it someday replace Google?

title: ECB hikes rates, sees significant increases ahead as it announces plan to shrink balance sheet
description: The European Central Bank opted for a smaller rate hike at its Thursday meeting, taking its key rate from 1.5% to 2%.

title: Didn't get a big raise this year? It could come in early 2023
description: The forecast for big raises is pretty good, at least for now.

title: Binance CEO Zhao brushes off $2.1 billion FTX clawback concerns
description: Binance CEO Changpeng "CZ" Zhao brushed off questions about whether the exchange would be able to handle a potential $2.1 billion clawback of FTX funds.

title: U.S. slaps restrictions on Chinese chipmaker and other companies over national security worries
description: The new designations also take aim at Russia-linked entities supporting that country's military invasion of Ukraine, the Commerce Department said.

title: Bank of England hikes key rate by 50 basis points, will continue to respond 'forcefully' if needed
description: The central bank's Monetary Policy Committee voted 6-3 in favor of the half-percentage point hike.

title: Shaq distances himself from crypto and FTX collapse: ‘I was just a paid spokesperson’
description: Shaquille O'Neal says he doesn't believe in crypto, a month after being named in a class-action lawsuit against now-bankrupt cryptocurrency exchange FTX.

title: UN nuclear watchdog to visit Tehran as Iran enriches uranium at its highest level ever
description: The IAEA will send a delegation to Tehran on Dec. 18 to clarify outstanding issues linked to nuclear particles discovered at undeclared Iranian sites.

title: Prince Harry says Prince William screamed and shouted at him in new record-breaking Netflix documentary
description: Prince Harry described the terror of being shouted at by his brother, Prince William, during a summit to discuss his and wife Meghan's royal roles, in a new Netflix documentary.

title: 'Avatar: The Way of Water' review roundup: See it on the biggest screen possible, critics say
description: Critics say James Cameron's "Avatar: The Way of Water," is a stunning piece of cinema. It scored a "Fresh" rating on Rotten Tomatoes.

title: Bitcoin drops following Fed decision after topping $18,000 for first time in over a month
description: Bitcoin fell from the $18,000 mark after the Fed raised its benchmark interest rate and indicated there would be further hikes next year.

title: Swiss central bank hikes interest rates by 50 basis points to counter 'further spread of inflation'
description: The Swiss National Bank has increased its benchmark interest rate for the third time this year, taking it to 1%.

title: China reopening brings both risks and opportunities, Asian Development Bank says
description: China's reopening would pose both upside and downside risks to the country's economy, Albert Park, chief economist at the Asian Development Bank said.

title: Recession fears could trigger a 'lipstick' effect on deal activity next year
description: Global deal volume and size decreased this year amid macro headwinds. Recession fears could see buyers increasingly focus on smaller deals.

title: Asia's year in review: Who had it good — and who had it bad — in 2022
description: With hopes that Covid is in retreat and that inflation will moderate in the year ahead, we take a last look at who had it good and who had it bad in 2022.

title: Elon Musk sells another huge chunk of Tesla shares
description: The transactions took place between Monday and Wednesday this week according to the filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: China's retail sales shrink far more than expected, while industrial production disappoints
description: A day before the data release, China's National Bureau of Statistics canceled its in-person press conference set for Thursday without explanation.

title: FTX insider turned on Sam Bankman-Fried days before bankruptcy, flagging potential fraud to regulators
description: Former FTX co-CEO Ryan Salame disclosed "possible mishandling of clients' assets" by Sam Bankman-Fried to Bahamian regulators just before FTX bankruptcy filing.
